Authors:
Monica Patricia Gauna, Susana Alejandra Gutierrez, Gustavo
Angel Bich, Maria Lorena Castrillo, Pedro Dario Zapata, Maria Graciela
Cabrera
Title:
Alternaria alternata causing foliar blight on Chrysanthemum
morifolium in Corrientes, Argentina
Keywords:
Fungus, Etiology, Pathogenicity, Morphological
Identification, ITS rDNA.
Abstract:
Several species of Alternaria are identified as the main
cause of “blight” in the chrysanthemum crops, in the Province of
Corrientes, Argentina. To clarify this situation, samples taken from the
production area have been tested in Concepción and nearby areas. After
that, pathogenic tests have been implemented and have been identified
through positive pathogenic analysis. Making a cross-checking of the ITS
rDNA sequence of monosporic strain with molecular databases, it was
observed a percentage of 100% similarity with sequences of Alternaria
alternata, confirming the results of the morphological studies. In
addition, a distance tree genetic analysis confirmed the taxonomic
identity of the Alternaria strain from C. morifolium samples as A.
alternata.
